comments.text: Wonder if the rest of the series will be like this. I'd be happy either way.
I love the feel of this episode. I hope the same thing you do
I honestly hope it does, I feel like if it turns into a somewhat action around the end it might just ruin it for me unless they pace it right.
Same. This was the strongest episode yet, at least for me. The entire lab thing with powers and shit was really not all that interesting.

Even if they do pace it right it's hard to sell this show as something consistent. 

How can you call a show like this cute with this episode as an example even though just a couple episodes before we had Sana get shot in the leg. 

It's gonna be a hard sell to people, especially since a ton of people were turned off by that god awful car scene in the first episode. 

We'll see what happens though and I hope to be proven wrong with you guys being right.
I don't mind the transition. Life is like that, and I'm pretty sure we'll still see those other Alice girls. I like that the show just went super SOL on us though.

Totally the cute series that I bought in for.  I’m currently watching the series in my bed because I don’t want to get up.  Totally identified with Sana in the beginning of this episode.  The momentary existential  struggle of trying to get out of bed.


>Is he your grandpa?


>yes, Zoroku’s totally old


[](#laughter)


Exactly how child me would have acted.   They really bring out children’s innocent lack of filter in Sana.  I’m chuckling throughout the episode.


My one complaint of the series is that the adult female characters look so much alike.  I thought for sure that the engaged woman was someone that was seen before

> I’m currently watching the series in my bed because I don’t want to get up. Totally identified with Sana in the beginning of this episode.

It's such a good feeling, isn't it?

> Exactly how child me would have acted.

To be fair, the translation is not quite literal. From my understanding, it's closer to

Is he your old man?

Yes, he's a very old man.

Someone who actually speaks Japanese can correct me, this is just based on what I've picked up on from watching anime, plus that both used the word Oji-chan.

Even if that is the translation, it would not negate the fact Sana said something insensitive.


[](#yuishrug)

Yeah, I'm just saying that it makes a difference that they use the same word.

In the original translation it sounds like Sana associates "grandpa" with old immediately and says that, yeah he really is old. In mine it's feels more like Sana misunderstands as something like "He's an old man, right?" and then she just agrees with her, because that's what she thinks.

The slight difference that I'm getting at is that in the first case it feels more intentional, while in the second it's more like she doesn't really know that it may be insensitive especially since the other girl said pretty much the same thing.

> My one complaint of the series is that the adult female characters look so much alike. I thought for sure that the engaged woman was someone that was seen before

I kind of expected some kind of a subplot about the fact that the woman--who looks like a highschooler--is marrying someone who looks so old.

Zoroku briefly touched on it but then it wasn't brought up again.
Maybe it will, I'll imagine that Zoroku will provide flowers for the wedding ceremony.

Man, I'm glad that the whole Sana getting lost issue was resolved in such a calm manner. I'm totally okay with the rest of the season being like this, with Sana slowly learning more about the normal life and living with Sanae and Zouroku. I just hope that we get to see more of Twins at some points, since they're also p fun.

I'm thinking like, perhaps the endgame would be society going to shit because a shitton of Dreams pop up and start wreaking havoc with their newfound powers, and the Dreams formerly with the research facility show up as reinforcements for Sana and co. Not sure how out of line that would be with the themes of the series but...
I hope so too but I'm guessing this will likely be the break episode and with the next one we'll be right back into some kind of plot hanging over our heads.

> I just hope that we get to see more of Twins at some points

Given next episode's title, I have good hopes that we will see them again.
Nah, the new friends are probably gonna be the two new characters described in the compilation special.
I can imagine a sequence where Zoroku tells Sana, "You need to make some friends" and Sana comes back with the twins.  And Zoroku dejectedly mutterring "not those kind of friends"
Did Zouroku just give Alice the "With great power comes great responsibility" monologue?

Fortunately not. I'm sure Sana will have plenty of responsibilities when she gets older, but right now she just have to learn all kinds of things - including how to get through everyday life without her powers.
I don't think so. And don't jinx it! We know what happened to the last dude that gave that monologue. -_-
[](/s "Uncle Ben, never forget")

"Are we married now?"

Sana is the cutest when she tries to impress

[](#kinirohug)
The most adorable part is how she wrote her own name on the mailbox

*Sana takes out power crystal*    
"Zouroku's words echoed... There's a time and place for everything, but not now"   
    
Professor Oak confirmed.

Well that was just plain adorable, got a little teary eyed at the adoption papers ngl. 

A very nice Amaama/Usagi Drop feeling episode, though I'm surprised he didn't scold Sana for wandering around alone!

well, first, he's old, and second, that old man is a respectable man, he didn't tell her to wait there, so she didn't

it's not entirely her fault, and the old man is very patient.  everyone has different teaching methods

Please.... Not Usagi Drop... 

And i was trying my hardest for dirty stuff not to come up, and i come here and see this
actually scared of it turning out to be Usagi Drop again
I really hope it doesn't...

Firstly, okay I'm glad I was not the only one who thought Usagi Drop.

Secondly, thank god that didn't exist in the anime so we're probably safe

Finally, if anyone is marrying anyone it will be Sana and Sanae. I mean goddamn that girl is touchy.
Can you spoil me what comes up in the usagi drop manga?
[Usagi No Drop Manga Spoiler](/s "Psuedo-Incest between someone with 20 years difference")

[Usagi Drop manga](/s " Just to clarify just after where the anime ends there is a 10 yearish 
 timeskip and she is in hs. They do a asspull retcon and have it turn out she isn't actually related to him at all and his grandfather had just been taking care of her. She falls in love with him and they get together as a couple. Though from the sounds of it he wasn't really into it and more just goes along with it.")

This was everything I wanted form this anime. If they can can keep this quality through the rest of the season then it will be one of my favorites.

Sana is with Zouroku, all is right in the world.
I'll take six more episodes just like this one, thanks!

How can a creature be as cute as Sana? 

[](#hugbear)

i think that comment face is cuter....

[](#hugbear)
My little psychic can't be this cute.
She's not human, that's how.
Shut up ! Minnie C
[Very!](http://i.imgur.com/ysiexd9.png)
So Sana's catchphrase from this point on is "it stinks"? The fact she yelled those out while smiling is quite adorable.

I think this is because she used to live in her own created world where everything likely had no smell because she didn't know what smell was. She lived in a sterile world before now she lives in one that's alive with smells and sights and sounds.
That could be the reason, but regardless of the reason it is still adorable.
Yes it's incredibly adorable, was just mentioning the reasoning is from the plot.

That ending theme music when they asked Sana to be part of the family it just full of beauty and happiness. They don't over play this theme so when you hear it just fills you with emotion.  
Fantastic episode. I hope we get a few more like this.
You can thank TO-MAS for that music! They also did the music for Flip Flappers.
My Status: Healed
Lets go watch some grave of the fireflies so we can enjoy the healing process again.
NAWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW

That was so cute!!! Really hoping it can continue being like this.

I felt like i could identify with Sana simply because i also got a haircut today x)

Next episode: "Friends" OMG, is it actually gonna continue being just an adorable SoL???

> is it actually gonna continue being just an adorable SoL?

It's pretty incredible that we can legitimately ask this question. I'm fine either way, but I kinda don't want it to get dark again so I'm rooting for the SoL route.
I really hope so, the more plot/action-heavy episodes were kind of a letdown so far.
I really like the slice of life style and hope it stays but after the first five episodes I can't help but think something bad is lurking around the corner.

Yeah, everyone keeps saying how great the SoL is, but I can't help but feel like the first darker part will come back in force when we least expect it (I almost expected her to get kidnapped again in the beauty salon)

Heartmelting!

After the dramatic last few episodes this was genuinely lovely. I love how Zouroku and Sana come off as real people; he's a gruff old guy but genuinely kind even if he can come off as harsh, while the little motions and things Sana does ring so true for a real child rather than as so often happens in anime an adult drawn smaller.

So many things, I'm happy he wants her to use her powers, as he said it's part of what hakes her her, she just need to learn to use it carefully just like a kid going through a growth spurt needs to be careful they don't use too much strength or hit something as their limbs get longer. I loved her typical childish response, she didn't understand the depth of his sentiment and just took it to mean don't use powers. I also love how the authorities (seen through police-dude) are being reasonable about this, they keep an eye on things but they're giving everything a fair chance and that helps keep the focus on the growth of the characters as it should.

I hope the series balances bits like this with the ongoing plot; while I loved this episode to bits I want to see the twins also get outside and Sana get to show them what she now understands all about the world.
Such a feel good episode. This was especially my favorite part  http://i.imgur.com/EKMxMoI.jpg
Why you do dis

[Whoo!](http://i.imgur.com/Or738UA.png)

Sana Kashimura really deserves all the cool adults and Sanae after what Sana's been through.
I'm gonna cry by thend of this aren't I.

[This episode **in a nutshell**](#scrumptiouslymoe)

This was the nice SoL part about a grandpa and a random cute girl that we were curious the show would be about! 

Although I feel that this is more of relaxation episode before the next plot begins but in all honesty it appears a good chunk of us prefers the show to be like this episode.

Amaama to Inazuma vibes instantly when i saw the second half. This is what i wanted from this series and also expected from the beginning. Continue to the end with this and it might end up in my top 5 non-sequels after all.
I'm loving the slice of life episodes but I really hope we get some more conflict and fight scenes.

This was one of the most heartwarming episodes I've seen all season, and I truly hope they keep this lighthearted coming-of-age format until the end. If it does, this will be a definite contender for AOTS for me personally.
A good way to start part 2, just daily life with the new Kashimura family. Really loving this series so far!

I don't mind if the rest of the series is just Sana getting accustomed to normal human life and this show becoming purely SoL. Seriously it was a really sweet episode! Especially the part where Zoroku hands Sana the adoption papers! <3 For a minute I was actually scared something unexpected would happen at the end of the episode.
Fuck, this might be the cutest episode of anything this season. I'd like it if the rest of the show from now on was like this episode, but I'm not sure how likely that is.

The TO-MAS music makes it so heartwarming with the adorable visuals. I can always have more Sana and Sanae interactions, they're way too adorable. Next episode we get to see Sana meet the two friends they talked about in last weeks special.

Ok just started watching this ep: Already melting from how adorable it is.  
After OP, still melting.

That was so sweet I could die. Just so relaxed and genuine.

*I love it* 

Not sure what the rest of the series will entail but I'd be satisfied with more of this.

So much light and fluffy feels.

Well, that answers one of my questions, what ever happened to the spotted pig. I'm glad I watched the special last week, it gave me a good mental image of Ootsuka Akio, and now every time Zouroko speaks a line I can picture his Akio's face in my mind.

So, in the first episode we got Zouroku driving a classic 70s mini, and in this one his employees are driving a classic VW bus (last time I checked a mint condition bus like that was worth a small fourtune) I guess the director of the series likes really old school cars.

I could get used to this new vibe the show is going for (but we all know this will change within time)

Welcome back, Alice (previous was a recap?)

This was a nice slice of life summer breeze episode. But do not forget the base of the Girls. Do we saw all of them yet? Do no other girls felling mad about losing their home? or the opposite, thanks to her, they enjoy freedom and are still child in mind? Do these kids need friends?

You need still some sort of red line, only Slice of Life will get dull with time (in my eyes)

But, yes. i enjoyed this episode. Good Work everyone

I didnt think I would like her haircut but she's still adorable with short hair. 

Also I'm glad zouroku plans on giving her the pig still.

when i saw the new key visual with short hair Sana i thought it was weird and didnt like the short hair

I was dumb! Its adorable after watching it all happen. I thought the doing her hair was a nice thing between her and Sanae, well shes oficially adopted now so theres a lot more than that to look foward to.

I hope the show keeps going like this for a bit more, at least until we get to see Sana in school, that will be a fun episode for sure.
If Sana isn't best girl of the season something is wrong.
These episodes are like the nice and chill calm before a huge storm.
This was a good episode. Happy and cheery.....something bad is going to happen soon.

This episode was comfy as can be!

Now all we need is the twins to come and join in the slice of life happiness and this can be as perfect as it gets.
Soiled it, SOILED IT
Very wholesome episode. Warm my cold heart.
This is my favourite episode so far. I wish all the rest of the episodes could be like this.
Loved this episode. The early episodes focused on action and drama have set up this slice of life stuff to feel all the more satisfying.
Sana gives off some Yotsuba vibe...

I can't stop smiling now. Such a pleasant, happy and feel-good episode, ^^how ^^long ^^is ^^this ^^going ^^to ^^last.

Sana's new haircut is cute, the way she plays with her pig-light-cord-thingy is cute, her interactions with Sanae are cute, the whole thing is SO GODDAMN CUTE.
So like this is episodes, probably seasons off, but I feel like eventually she end up learning everything that is needed to know and essentially transcend her humanity. A parting of ways.
I'll be really disappointed if it goes "Comfy SoL" over action and sci-fi etc. because I don't like comfy SoL :( But I seem to be in the minority on that
I think a lot of people who dropped the show after the premiere are missing out. The first episode was admittedly flawed, but it's only improved since then!
I love the ED so much, and it makes me want to go watch Flip Flappers again.
Imo that bob cut pretty much guarantees that woman she talked to was her future self, though I was pretty sure of that anyway.
Another episode that feels like it was the last... Finally something that  leaves me in a good mood instead of II phase cancer induced by cliffhangers.
Am I the only one who thinks of Agiri from Kill me Baby when Sanae talks ? Idk, the voice actress gives me the same "I'm so fucking high right now" vibe.

This show just feels like it's meandering now. What is the point of the hugely dark intro arc, only to turn it into a moe slice of life show with unnecessary loli bath scenes, and groping by the older sister character?

Don't trick me into thinking the show is going to be about more than generic moe slice of life and then rip that plot thread away halfway through. It's just whiplash for your viewers' expectations. Maybe we'll get back to that once they introduce the two new girls, but this just felt like a filler episode.

Just like with Akashic Records I have huge qualms about the lack of any psychological trauma after a hugely tragic event, in this case, Sana getting shot in the back of a car, after being held down by force and peeing herself. Apparently none of that mattered. No nightmares or anything. Tra la la, life goes on, nothing to see here. She's a little girl. She would be recovering from that for a WHILE, if not her entire life.

The one part I did enjoy was when Sana tripped and fell because of her ridiculously stupid anime hair.
I mean sure maybe a human would be traumatized forever by that but Sana isn't exactly a human.

Yes, but she's also not an adult emotionally. Even this episode she's asking "what's a family", "what's marriage", etc. She's like a child asking all these questions, and she's told Zoroku that she wants to become more human.

Yet, zero repercussions from what happened to her, emotionally. Do you have to be human to be afraid for your life after getting taken somewhere against your will and shot by a gun? Dogs have emotional trauma from being beaten and injured by their owners. 

My guess is that the creators' explanation for this would be that Alice rewrote her entire being at the end of the scene when she transformed herself into the hospital gown and healed herself. I just think that's poor writing.

This show feels very similar to [meta spoilers?](/s "Yuuki Yuuna is a Hero") so far. If it's going to be anything like that show, it's going back to darkness really soon. It's a calm before the storm. (BTW, I think there was a timeskip)
glad I skipped through this ep.

> skipping through anime episodes

For what purpose?
in case something plot-relevant happens.
Developing characters is just as important as plot development, is it not?
